description: Current inflation rate in Switzerland is 2.1% as of Q3 2024.
Swiss unemployment rate stands at 2.3%, among the lowest in Europe.
The Swiss National Bank (SNB) maintains a policy interest rate of 1.75%.
Swiss franc (CHF) remains strong against major currencies, trading at approximately 0.95 CHF per EUR.
Switzerland's GDP growth forecast for 2024 is 1.2%, reflecting stable economic conditions.
Swiss government debt-to-GDP ratio is approximately 38%, one of the lowest among developed nations.
The Swiss banking sector maintains strong capital adequacy ratios, well above Basel III requirements.
Swiss consumer confidence index has remained stable with moderate optimism about economic prospects.
Switzerland's trade surplus continues to grow, driven by pharmaceutical and precision manufacturing exports.
Real estate prices in major Swiss cities have stabilized after years of growth, with Zurich and Geneva showing modest increases.
The Swiss stock market index (SMI) has shown steady performance, reflecting stable corporate earnings.
Switzerland maintains its AAA credit rating from major rating agencies, reflecting fiscal prudence.
Cross-border capital flows into Switzerland remain strong, driven by its reputation as a safe haven.
Swiss household savings rate is approximately 18%, indicating strong financial resilience.
The Swiss financial sector employs approximately 6% of the workforce and contributes significantly to GDP.
